subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Christianity's Global Shift South
description: One-minute skill: Christianity's Global Shift South.

hook.text: Christianity is dying in Europe. But it's exploding in Africa, Asia, and Latin America. The faith is moving south.

buildup.text: In 1900, 80% of Christians lived in Europe and North America. Today, most live in the Global South.

discovery.text: African Christianity is the fastest-growing. Nigeria alone may have more churchgoers than all of Western Europe.

twist.text: Southern Christianity is often more conservative and charismatic than its Western counterpart, creating tension.

climax.text: The future of Christianity isn't European. It's African, Asian, and Latin American. The center of gravity has shifted.

punchline.text: Christianity's future is African and Asian. The West is its past.

quiz.question: Where is Christianity growing fastest today?
